page.title: 01Liskeard Area Gazetteer
page.content: Liskeard is an ancient municipal borough and stannary town(Pop.6000) that serves as a centre for a large rural community of villages and farms (Pop.25000).The land is used predominately for mixed farming and Liskeard holds a Cattle Market on Monday and Thursday.The town has close to 100 shops with Early Closing Day on Wednesday. Expansion plans(housing and light industry) effect Liskeard and the nearby larger villages.Liskeard is 'twinned'with the Brittany town of Quimperle. Liskeard is on the main tourist route into Cornwall (A38) and the main railway line from London to Penzance. Liskeard is 9 miles from Looe,18 miles from Plymouth,19 miles from Tavistock, 61 miles from Exeter, and 234 miles from London.
